title: Files
noPDFSupport: Your browser does not support PDFs. Please download the PDF to view it:
openWithPublicGateway: Try opening it instead with your <1>public gateway</1>.
openWithLocalAndPublicGateway: Try opening it instead with your <1>local gateway</1> or <3>public gateway</3>.
cantBePreviewed: Sorry, this file can‚Äôt be previewed

cliModal.extraNotesPinning: This command is only for local pinning/unpinning. If you want to use a remote pinning service, consult that service's documentation to learn how to pin/unpin from the command line.

shareModal.title: Share files
shareModal.description: Copy the link below and share it with your friends.

renameModal.descriptionFile: Choose a new name for this file.
renameModal.descriptionFolder: Choose a new name for this folder.

removeModal.descriptionItem: {count, plural, one {Are you sure you want to remove this item? It will no longer appear on the Files screen, and will be permanently removed in the next scheduled cleanup (though copies may exist on other IPFS nodes). This action and cannot be reversed.} other {Are you sure you want to remove these {count} items? They will no longer appear on the Files screen, and will be permanently removed in the next scheduled cleanup (though copies may exist on other IPFS nodes). This action cannot be reversed.}}
removeModal.descriptionFolder: {count, plural, one {Are you sure you want to remove this folder? It will no longer appear on the Files screen, and will be permanently removed in the next scheduled cleanup (though copies may exist on other IPFS nodes). This action cannot be reversed.} other {Are you sure you want to remove these {count} folders? They will no longer appear on the Files screen, and will be permanently removed in the next scheduled cleanup (though copies may exist on other IPFS nodes). This action cannot be reversed.}}
removeModal.descriptionFile: {count, plural, one {Are you sure you want to remove this file? It will no longer appear on the Files screen, and will be permanently removed in the next scheduled cleanup (though copies may exist on other IPFS nodes). This action cannot be reversed.} other {Are you sure you want to remove these {count} files? They will no longer appear on the Files screen, and will be permanently removed in the next scheduled cleanup (though copies may exist on other IPFS nodes). This action cannot be reversed.}}

pinningModal.title: Select where you would like to pin these items.
pinningModal.footer: Need to add or configure a pinning service? Go to <1>Settings</1>.

addByPathModal.title: Import from IPFS
addByPathModal.description: Insert an IPFS path (CID) to import.

newFolderModal.title: New folder
newFolderModal.description: Insert the name of the folder you want to create.

filesList.noFiles: <0>No files in this directory. Click the ‚ÄúImport‚Äù button to add some.</0>

addFilesInfo: <0>No files here yet! Add files to your local IPFS node by clicking the <1>Import</1> button above.</0>
companionInfo: <0>As you are using <1>IPFS Companion</1>, the files view is limited to files added while using the extension.</0>

step1.title: Files page
step1.paragraph1: <0>This is where the files on your <1>Mutable File System (MFS)</1> live. You can add files or folders and manage them from this page.</0>

step2.title: Breadcrumbs
step2.paragraph1: These breadcrumbs display the path to your current directory. You can‚Ä¶
step2.bullet1: Click an individual breadcrumb to go to that directory
step2.bullet2: Right-click a breadcrumb to get the actions menu for that directory
step2.bullet3: Drag files onto a breadcrumb to move or import them

step3.title: Add files
step3.paragraph1: Here you can see how many blocks and files you have pinned.
step3.paragraph2: You can add files or folders to your repo through the dropdown on the right.
step3.paragraph3: <0>If you want to add something that is already on IPFS, you can import it to your MFS by passing its <1>Content Identifier (CID)</1>.</0>

step5.title: Files list
step5.paragraph1: Finally, the listing where you can find your files and folders. Drag and drop files or folders to add them.
step5.paragraph2: You can share or download files, inspect them in the IPLD Explorer, rename or remove them!
step5.paragraph3: Pro tip: drag and drop a file from any other page of the Web UI to add them to the root of your MFS.

allBlocksDescription: Total size of blocks on your entire IPFS node; this includes everything in Files, plus all locally pinned items and any temporary cached data
filesDescription: Total size of data in the current directory (if a subdirectory, the size of all data in Files is also displayed)
cidNotFileNorDir: The current link isn't a file, nor a directory. Try to <1>inspect</1> it instead.

publishModal.title: Publish to IPNS
publishModal.help: Go to Settings to learn about IPNS and create more keys.
publishModal.sharingPrompt: Copy the link below and share it with others. The IPNS address will resolve as long as your node remains available on the network once a day to refresh the IPNS record.
publishModal.pleaseWait: Please wait while the initial 20 copies of the updated IPNS record are stored with the help of DHT peers‚Ä¶

noPinsInProgress: All done, no remote pins in progress.
